original: “Bhante nāgasena, bhāsitampetaṁ bhagavatā—
analyzed: bhante nāgasena bhāsitam petam bhagavatā
translated: “Venerable Nāgasena, this too was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘mettāya, bhikkhave, cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ekādasānisaṁsā pāṭikaṅkhā.
analyzed: mettāya bhikkhave cetaḥ vimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya su samāraddhāya ekādasa anisasā pāṭikaṅkhā
translated: ‘Bhikkhus, when the deliverance of will by loving-kindness has been cultivated, developed, made much of, given a foundation, established, consolidated, and properly undertaken, eleven benefits may be expected.

original: Katame ekādasa?🔽Sukhaṁ supati, sukhaṁ paṭibujjhati, na pāpakaṁ supinaṁ passati, manussānaṁ piyo hoti,🔽amanussānaṁ piyo hoti, devatā rakkhanti, nāssa aggi vā visaṁ vā satthaṁ vā kamati,
analyzed: katame ekādasa  sukham supati sukham paṭibujjhati na pāpakam supinam passati manussānam piyaḥ hoti  amanussānam piyaḥ hoti devatāḥ rakkhanti na assa aggi vā visam vā sattham vā kamati
translated: What are the eleven?

original: tuvaṭaṁ cittaṁ samādhiyati, mukhavaṇṇo vippasīdati, asammūḷho kālaṁ karoti, uttariṁ
analyzed: tuvaṭam cittam samādhiyati mukha vaṇṇaḥ vippasīdati asammūḷhaḥ kālam karoti uttari
translated: One sleeps well and wakes happily; one does not see bad dreams; one is dear to human beings; one is dear to non-human beings; the gods protect one; neither fire, poison, or sword can affect one; one’s mind quickly becomes concentrated; one’s complexion becomes clear; one dies unconfused;

original: appaṭivijjhanto brahmalokūpago hotī’ti.
analyzed: a paṭivijjhantaḥ brahma loka upagaḥ hoti iti
translated: if one penetrates no further, one is at least headed for the Brahma-world.’

original: Puna ca tumhe bhaṇatha—
analyzed: puna ca tumhe bhaṇatha
translated: But then you say:

original: ‘sāmo kumāro mettāvihārī migasaṅghena parivuto pavane vicaranto pīḷiyakkhena raññā viddho visapītena sallena tattheva mucchito patito’ti.
analyzed: sāmaḥ kumāraḥ mettā vihārī miga saṅghena parivutaḥ pavane vicarantaḥ pīḷiyakkhena raññā viddhaḥ visa pītena sallena tattha iva mucchito patito ti
translated: ‘Prince Saṅkha, who was dwelling in loving-kindness, was surrounded by a herd of deer in the forest, and was struck by King Pīḷiya with an arrow smeared with poison, and fell down unconscious right there.’

original: Yadi, bhante nāgasena, bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: yadi bhante nāgasena bhagavatā bhaṇita
translated: If, revered Nāgasena, this was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘mettāya bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: mettāya bhikkhave pe
translated: ‘Through loving-kindness, monks, …🔽one is reborn in the world of Brahmā,’

original: brahmalokūpago hotī’ti, tena hi ‘sāmo kumāro mettāvihārī migasaṅghena parivuto pavane
analyzed: brahma loka upagaḥ hoti iti tena hi sāmaḥ kumāraḥ mettā vihārī miga saṅghena parivutaḥ pavane
translated: then it is not correct that ‘Prince Saṅkha, who was dwelling in loving-kindness, was surrounded by a herd of deer in the forest,

original: vicaranto pīḷiyakkhena raññā viddho visapītena sallena tattheva mucchito patito’ti🔽yaṁ vacanaṁ, taṁ micchā.
analyzed: vicarantaḥ pīḷiyakkhena raññā viddhaḥ visa pītena sallena tattha iva mucchito patito ti  yam tam micchā
translated: and was struck by King Pīḷiya with an arrow smeared with poison, and fell down unconscious right there.’🔽If Prince Saṅkha, who was dwelling in loving-kindness, was surrounded by a herd of deer in the forest,

original: Yadi sāmo kumāro mettāvihārī migasaṅghena parivuto pavane vicaranto pīḷiyakkhena raññā viddho visapītena sallena tattheva mucchito patito, tena hi ‘mettāya, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: yadi sāmaḥ kumāraḥ mettā vihārī miga saṅghena parivutaḥ pavane vicarantaḥ pīḷiyakkhena raññā viddhaḥ visa pītena sallena tattha iva mucchitaḥ patitaḥ tena hi mettāya bhikkhave pe
translated: and was struck by King Pīḷiya with an arrow smeared with poison, and fell down unconscious right there, then it is not correct that ‘Through loving-kindness, monks, …

original: satthaṁ vā kamatī’ti tampi vacanaṁ micchā.
analyzed: sattham vā kamati iti vacanam micchā
translated: one is not hurt by a weapon.’

original: Ayampi ubhato koṭiko pañho sunipuṇo parisaṇho sukhumo gambhīro, api sunipuṇānaṁ manujānaṁ🔽gatte sedaṁ moceyya, so tavānuppatto, vijaṭehi taṁ mahājaṭājaṭitaṁ, anāgatānaṁ jinaputtānaṁ
analyzed: ayam pi ubhatas koṭikaḥ pañhaḥ su nipuṇaḥ parisaṇhaḥ sukhumaḥ gambhīraḥ api  gatte sa idam moceyya saḥ tava anuppattaḥ vijaṭehi tam mahā jaṭā jaṭita anāgatānam jinaputtāna
translated: which might make the hair stand up for those who are not sure of themselves.🔽It has come to you, O you who are free from the tangle,

original: cakkhuṁ dehi nibbāhanāyā”ti.
analyzed: cakkhum dehi nibbāhanāya ati
translated: give the eye to the future sons of the Conqueror for the attainment of Nibbāna.”

original: “Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā—
analyzed: mahā rāja bhagavatā
translated: “This, sire, has been said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘mettāya bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: mettāya bhikkhave pe
translated: ‘Bhikkhus, one who is full of loving-kindness …

original: satthaṁ vā kamatī’ti.
analyzed: sattham vā kamati iti
translated: can strike him with a dart smeared with poison.’

original: Sāmo ca kumāro mettāvihārī migasaṅghena parivuto pavane vicaranto pīḷiyakkhena raññā viddho visapītena sallena tattheva mucchito patito, tattha pana, mahārāja, kāraṇaṁ atthi.
analyzed: sāmaḥ ca kumāraḥ mettā vihārī miga saṅghena parivutaḥ pavane vicarantaḥ pīḷiyakkhena raññā viddhaḥ visa pītena sallena tattha iva mucchitaḥ patitaḥ tattha pana mahā rāja kāraṇam atthi
translated: And Prince Saṅkha, who was full of loving-kindness, was wandering in the forest surrounded by a herd of deer when he was struck by King Pāyāfifi’s elephant with a poisoned dart and fell down right there in a faint. But there is a reason for that, sire.

original: Katamaṁ tattha kāraṇaṁ?
analyzed: katamam tattha kāraṇa
translated: What is the reason?

original: Nete, mahārāja, guṇā puggalassa, mettābhāvanāyete guṇā, sāmo, mahārāja, kumāro ghaṭaṁ ukkhipanto tasmiṁ khaṇe mettābhāvanāya pamatto ahosi.
analyzed: na ite mahā rāja guṇā puggalassa mettā bhāvanāya ete guṇā sāmaḥ mahā rāja kumāraḥ ghaṭam ukkhipantaḥ tasmin khaṇe mettā bhāvanāya pamattaḥ ahosi
translated: These are not the qualities of the person, sire, but the qualities of the development of loving-kindness. Prince Saṅkha, sire, was raising his water-pot at that moment and was heedless of the development of loving-kindness.

original: Yasmiṁ, mahārāja, khaṇe puggalo mettaṁ samāpanno hoti, na tassa puggalassa tasmiṁ khaṇe aggi vā visaṁ vā satthaṁ vā kamati.
analyzed: yasmi mahā rāja khaṇe puggalaḥ mettam samāpannaḥ hoti na tassa puggalassa tasmin khaṇe aggi vā visam vā sattham vā kamati
translated: In the moment, sire, when a person has attained loving-kindness, fire, poison or a weapon does not affect that person.

original: Tassa ye keci ahitakāmā upagantvā taṁ na passanti, na tasmiṁ okāsaṁ labhanti.
analyzed: tassa ye keci ahita kāmāḥ upagantvā tam na passanti na tasmin okāsam labhanti
translated: Those who, wishing him harm, approach him, do not see him, they do not find an opportunity in him.

original: Nete, mahārāja, guṇā puggalassa, mettābhāvanāyete guṇā.
analyzed: na ite mahā rāja guṇā puggalassa mettā bhāvanāya ite guṇā
translated: These qualities, sire, are not of the person, they are the qualities of the development of loving-kindness.

analyzed: tassa sarā khittāḥ upagantvā patanti vikiranti na tasmin okāsam labhanti na isaḥ mahā rāja
translated: and arrows shot at him would fall down, would scatter and disperse, they would not find an opportunity in him. This quality, sire,

original: guṇo saṅgāmasūrassa, abhejjakavacajālikāyeso guṇo, yassa sarā khittā upagantvā patanti vikiranti.
analyzed: guṇo saṅgāmasūrassa guṇo yassa sarā khittāḥ upagantvā patanti vikiranti
translated: is not of the hero in battle, it is the quality of the impenetrable armour and helmet, by which arrows shot at him fall down, scatter and disperse.

original: Yasmiṁ, mahārāja, khaṇe puggalo mettaṁ samāpanno hoti, na tassa puggalassa tasmiṁ khaṇe aggi vā visaṁ vā satthaṁ vā kamati.
analyzed: yasmi mahā rāja khaṇe puggalaḥ mettam samāpannaḥ hoti na tassa puggalassa tasmin khaṇe aggi vā visam vā sattham vā kamati
translated: Your Majesty, at the moment a person has attained loving-kindness, neither fire nor poison nor sword can affect that person.

original: Tassa ye keci ahitakāmā upagantvā taṁ na passanti, tasmiṁ okāsaṁ na labhanti, nete, mahārāja, guṇā puggalassa, mettābhāvanāyete guṇā.
analyzed: tassa ye keci ahita kāmāḥ upagantvā tam na passanti tasmin okāsam na labhanti na ite mahā rāja guṇā puggalassa mettā bhāvanāya ete guṇā
translated: Those who wish him harm, on approaching him, do not see him, they do not find an opportunity, for these qualities are not the person’s, they are the qualities of the development of loving-kindness.

original: Idha pana, mahārāja, puriso dibbaṁ antaradhānaṁ mūlaṁ hatthe kareyya, yāva taṁ mūlaṁ tassa hatthagataṁ hoti, tāva na añño koci pakatimanusso taṁ purisaṁ passati.
analyzed: idha pana mahā rāja purisaḥ dibbam antaradhānam mūlam hatthe kareyya yāva tam mūlam tassa hattha gatam hoti tāva na aññaḥ koci pakati manussaḥ tam purisam passati
translated: Here, Your Majesty, a man might have in his hand the root of the heavenly wish-fulfilling gem. As long as that root is in his hand, no other ordinary human being can see that man.

original: Neso, mahārāja, guṇo purisassa, mūlasseso guṇo antaradhānassa, yaṁ so pakatimanussānaṁ cakkhupathe na dissati.
analyzed: na isaḥ mahā rāja guṇo purisassa mūlassa isaḥ guṇaḥ antaradhānassa yat so pakati manussānam cakkhu pathe na dissati
translated: This quality is not the man’s, this quality is of the root of the heavenly wish-fulfilling gem, that he is not seen by ordinary human beings.

original: Evameva kho, mahārāja, nete guṇā puggalassa, mettābhāvanāyete guṇā.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja na ite guṇā puggalassa mettā bhāvanāya ite guṇā
translated: In the same way, Your Majesty, these qualities are not the person’s, they are the qualities of the development of loving-kindness.

original: Yasmiṁ, mahārāja, khaṇe puggalo mettaṁ samāpanno hoti, na tassa puggalassa tasmiṁ khaṇe aggi vā visaṁ vā satthaṁ vā kamati.
analyzed: yasmi mahā rāja khaṇe puggalaḥ mettam samāpannaḥ hoti na tassa puggalassa tasmin khaṇe aggi vā visam vā sattham vā kamati
translated: In the moment, sire, when a person has attained loving-kindness, fire, poison or a weapon does not affect that person.

original: Tassa ye keci ahitakāmā upagantvā taṁ na passanti, na tasmiṁ okāsaṁ labhanti.
analyzed: tassa ye keci ahita kāmāḥ upagantvā tam na passanti na tasmin okāsam labhanti
translated: Those who, wishing him harm, approach him, do not see him, they do not find an opportunity in him.

analyzed: na ite mahā rāja guṇā puggalassa mettā bhāvanāya ite guṇā
translated: These, sire, are not the qualities of the person, they are the qualities of the development of loving-kindness.

translated: is not able to be penetrated, these, sire, are not the qualities of the person, they are the qualities of the great cave, that a great, mighty rain

original: abhivassamāno na taṁ temeti.
analyzed: abhivassamānaḥ na tam temeti
translated: falling on it is not able to penetrate it.

original: Evameva kho, mahārāja, nete guṇā puggalassa, mettābhāvanāyete guṇā.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja na ite guṇā puggalassa mettā bhāvanāya ite guṇā
translated: Even so, sire, these are not the qualities of the person, they are the qualities of the development of loving-kindness.

original: Yasmiṁ, mahārāja, khaṇe puggalo mettaṁ samāpanno hoti, na tassa puggalassa tasmiṁ khaṇe aggi vā visaṁ vā satthaṁ vā kamati.
analyzed: yasmi mahā rāja khaṇe puggalaḥ mettam samāpannaḥ hoti na tassa puggalassa tasmin khaṇe aggi vā visam vā sattham vā kamati
translated: In the moment, sire, when a person has attained loving-kindness, fire, poison or a weapon does not affect that person.

original: Tassa ye keci ahitakāmā upagantvā taṁ na passanti, na tassa sakkonti ahitaṁ kātuṁ, nete, mahārāja, guṇā puggalassa, mettābhāvanāyete guṇā”ti.

translated: Those who come with the wish to do him harm do not see him, and they are unable to do him harm. These qualities, sire, do not belong to the man, they belong to the development of loving-kindness.”

original: “Acchariyaṁ, bhante nāgasena, abbhutaṁ, bhante nāgasena, sabbapāpanivāraṇā mettābhāvanā”ti.
analyzed: acchariya bhante nāgasena abbhuta bhante nāgasena sabba pāpa nivāraṇā mettā bhāvanā ati
translated: “It is wonderful, revered Nāgasena, it is marvellous how the development of loving-kindness wards off all evil.”

original: “Sabbakusalaguṇāvahā, mahārāja, mettābhāvanā hitānampi ahitānampi, ye te sattā viññāṇabaddhā, sabbesaṁ mahānisaṁsā mettābhāvanā saṁvibhajitabbā”ti.
analyzed: sabba kusala guṇa āvahā mahā rāja mettā bhāvanā hitānam pi ahitānam pi ye te sattā viññāṇa baddhā sabbesam mahā nisasā mettā bhāvanā sa vibhajitabbā ati
translated: “The development of loving-kindness, sire, brings all the good qualities, and it is of great benefit to all beings, whether they be helpful or not helpful, whether they be bound up with consciousness or not. The development of loving-kindness should be shared with all.”

original: Mettābhāvanānisaṁsapañho chaṭṭho.
analyzed: mettā bhāvanā nisasa pañho chaṭṭho
translated: Question six: the benefits of the development of loving-kindness.
